description.zh-cn: 著名英国哲学家，最具影响力的启蒙哲学家之一，被广泛形容为自由主义之父。
description.en: A famous English philosopher, one of the most influential Enlightenment thinkers, and is widely regarded as the Father of Liberalism.

description.zh-cn: 英格兰西南部的一个郡，约翰·洛克的出生地。
description.en: A county in South West England, birthplace of John Locke.

description.zh-cn: 英格兰东部的一个郡，约翰·洛克的逝世地。
description.en: A county in the East of England, where John Locke died.

description.zh-cn: 位于伦敦的一所著名公学，约翰·洛克曾在此就读。
description.en: A famous public school in London, where John Locke studied.

description.zh-cn: 位于英国牛津的世界顶尖公立研究型大学，约翰·洛克在此获得学士和硕士学位。
description.en: A world-leading public research university in Oxford, England, where John Locke received his bachelor's and master's degrees.

description.zh-cn: 英国的國家科學院，约翰·洛克是其院士。
description.en: The national academy of sciences of the United Kingdom, of which John Locke was a fellow.

nodes.id: 第一代沙夫茨伯里伯爵安东尼·阿什利-柯柏

zh-cn: 第一代沙夫茨伯里伯爵安东尼·阿什利-柯柏

description.zh-cn: 英国辉格党的创始人之一，曾任英国大法官。他是洛克的雇主和政治导师。
description.en: A founder of the Whig Party in England and Lord Chancellor of Great Britain. He was Locke's patron and political mentor.

description.zh-cn: 英国知名医师，曾在医学上指导约翰·洛克。
description.en: A renowned English physician who mentored John Locke in medicine.

description.zh-cn: 英国政治哲学家，其独裁主义政治哲学受到约翰·洛克的批评。
description.en: An English political philosopher whose authoritarian political philosophy was criticized by John Locke.

description.zh-cn: 英格兰、苏格兰和爱尔兰国王，洛克曾因被怀疑涉嫌刺杀他的阴谋而流亡。
description.en: King of England, Scotland, and Ireland. Locke was exiled due to suspicion of involvement in a plot to assassinate him.

description.zh-cn: 指1683年发生的一件刺杀英格兰国王查理二世的阴谋，约翰·洛克因被怀疑涉嫌此案而逃亡荷兰。
description.en: Refers to a plot in 1683 to assassinate King Charles II of England. John Locke fled to the Netherlands after being suspected of involvement.

description.zh-cn: 1688年发生在英国的一场不流血的政变，这场革命结束后，洛克得以返回英格兰。
description.en: A bloodless coup that took place in England in 1688. After this revolution, Locke was able to return to England.

description.zh-cn: 约翰·洛克最重要的政治论文之一，提出了政府正当性的理论，并反驳了君权神授说。
description.en: One of John Locke's most important political essays, which proposed a theory of legitimate government and refuted the divine right of kings.

description.zh-cn: 英国政治理论家，主张君权神授，其理论被洛克在《政府论》中驳斥。
description.en: An English political theorist who advocated for the divine right of kings, a theory refuted by Locke in his 'Two Treatises of Government'.

description.zh-cn: 被光荣革命推翻的英格兰国王，洛克的《政府论》暗示其统治违反了正当政府理论。
description.en: The King of England overthrown by the Glorious Revolution. Locke's 'Two Treatises of Government' implied that his rule violated the theory of legitimate government.

nodes.id: 达马里斯·库德沃斯·马沙姆

zh-cn: 达马里斯·库德沃斯·马沙姆

description.zh-cn: 约翰·洛克的密友，洛克晚年在她的乡下住所定居。
description.en: A close friend of John Locke, who spent his later years at her country home.

description.zh-cn: 英国物理学家、数学家，曾与约翰·洛克讨论各种议题。
description.en: An English physicist and mathematician who discussed various topics with John Locke.

description.zh-cn: 法国启蒙时代思想家，深受约翰·洛克著作的影响。
description.en: A French Enlightenment writer and philosopher, greatly influenced by the works of John Locke.

description.zh-cn: 日内瓦哲学家，其著作受到约翰·洛克的影响。
description.en: A Genevan philosopher whose works were influenced by John Locke.

en: Founding Fathers of the United States

description.zh-cn: 指签署《美国独立宣言》和《美国宪法》的政治领导人，他们的思想受到约翰·洛克理论的影响。
description.en: The political leaders who signed the Declaration of Independence or the United States Constitution, whose ideas were influenced by John Locke's theories.

description.zh-cn: 北美十三州宣告脱离大不列颠王国独立的文件，受到洛克的古典共和主义和自由主义观念影响。
description.en: The document in which the Thirteen Colonies declared their independence from Great Britain, influenced by Locke's concepts of classical republicanism and liberalism.

description.zh-cn: 法国哲学家，其著作启发了约翰·洛克的兴趣，但洛克反对其天赋观念理论。
description.en: A French philosopher whose writings sparked John Locke's interest, though Locke disagreed with his theory of innate ideas.

description.zh-cn: 约翰·洛克的哲学著作，提出了心灵是一块“白板”的假设，是英国经验主义的代表作。
description.en: A major philosophical work by John Locke, proposing the hypothesis that the mind is a 'tabula rasa' (blank slate), and a key text of British empiricism.

description.zh-cn: 一种意识形态和政治哲学，约翰·洛克被认为是其奠基者。
description.en: An ideology and political philosophy, of which John Locke is considered a founder.

description.zh-cn: 17至18世纪欧洲的一场知识分子及文化运动，约翰·洛克是其中最具影响力的思想家之一。
description.en: An intellectual and cultural movement in Europe during the 17th and 18th centuries. John Locke was one of its most influential thinkers.

description.zh-cn: 18世纪末北美十三殖民地脱离大英帝国，创建美国的革命。洛克的理论激励了这场革命。
description.en: The revolution in the late 18th century in which the Thirteen Colonies in North America broke away from the British Empire to create the United States. Locke's theories inspired this revolution.

description.zh-cn: 18世纪末在法国爆发的革命，洛克的理论对此产生了影响。
description.en: The revolution that occurred in France at the end of the 18th century, which was influenced by Locke's theories.

description.zh-cn: 英国历史上的一个政党，洛克的雇主沙夫茨伯里伯爵是其创始人之一，洛克的政治思想深受其影响。
description.en: A historical political party in England. Locke's patron, the Earl of Shaftesbury, was one of its founders, and Locke's political thought was greatly influenced by it.

description.zh-cn: 约翰·洛克出生于英格兰森麻实郡的威灵顿村。
description.en: John Locke was born in the village of Wrington, Somerset, England.

description.zh-cn: 1647年，约翰·洛克被送至伦敦的西敏公学就读。
description.en: In 1647, John Locke was sent to study at Westminster School in London.

description.zh-cn: 洛克在牛津大学基督堂学院就读，并分别于1656年、1658年和1664年获得学士、硕士和医学学士学位。
description.en: Locke studied at Christ Church, Oxford, and obtained a B.A. in 1656, an M.A. in 1658, and a B.Med. in 1664.

description.zh-cn: 约翰·洛克是皇家学会的院士。
description.en: John Locke was a Fellow of the Royal Society.

relationships.target: 第一代沙夫茨伯里伯爵安东尼·阿什利-柯柏

description.zh-cn: 1667年，洛克成为沙夫茨伯里伯爵的助手和个人医师，并担任贸易与种植园事务委员会的秘书。
description.en: In 1667, Locke became the assistant and personal physician to the Earl of Shaftesbury, and served as secretary to the Board of Trade and Plantations.

relationships.source: 第一代沙夫茨伯里伯爵安东尼·阿什利-柯柏

description.zh-cn: 沙夫茨伯里伯爵身为辉格党的创立者之一，对洛克的政治思想有极大影响，并可能鼓励洛克撰写了《政府论》。
description.en: As a founder of the Whig party, the Earl of Shaftesbury had a great influence on Locke's political thought and likely encouraged him to write 'Two Treatises of Government'.

description.zh-cn: 在伦敦期间，洛克在知名医师汤玛斯·西德纳姆的指导下继续研读医学。
description.en: While in London, Locke continued his medical studies under the guidance of the renowned physician Thomas Sydenham.

description.zh-cn: 1683年，由于被怀疑涉嫌刺杀查理二世国王的阴谋，洛克逃亡至荷兰。
description.en: In 1683, Locke fled to the Netherlands after being suspected of involvement in a plot to assassinate King Charles II.

description.zh-cn: 光荣革命结束后，洛克于1688年得以跟随奥兰治亲王的妻子返回英格兰，结束了其流亡生涯。
description.en: After the Glorious Revolution, Locke was able to return to England in 1688 with the wife of the Prince of Orange, ending his exile.

relationships.target: 达马里斯·库德沃斯·马沙姆

description.zh-cn: 洛克的密友玛莎姆女士邀请他自1691年起在她的乡下住所定居，直至去世。
description.en: Locke's close friend, Lady Masham, invited him to live at her country house from 1691 until his death.

description.zh-cn: 在他晚年于艾塞克斯郡定居期间，洛克经常与艾萨克·牛顿等人讨论各种议题。
description.en: During his later years in Essex, Locke frequently discussed various topics with Isaac Newton and others.

description.zh-cn: 《政府论》的第一篇有效地驳斥了罗伯特·菲尔默的君权神授主张。
description.en: The First Treatise of 'Two Treatises of Government' effectively refutes Robert Filmer's claims of the divine right of kings.

description.zh-cn: 《政府论》中，洛克批评了托马斯·霍布斯等人的独裁主义政治哲学。
description.en: In 'Two Treatises of Government', Locke criticized the authoritarian political philosophy of Thomas Hobbes and others.

description.zh-cn: 《政府论》提出了一套正当政府理论，并巧妙地暗示当时英国的詹姆斯二世已经违反了这个理论，为推翻其政权提供正当性。
description.en: 'Two Treatises of Government' proposed a theory of legitimate government and subtly implied that the contemporary King of England, James II, had violated this theory, justifying his overthrow.

description.zh-cn: 洛克被广泛视为自由主义的奠基者，其思想对自由主义的发展产生了巨大影响。
description.en: Locke is widely regarded as the founder of liberalism, and his ideas had a profound impact on its development.

description.zh-cn: 洛克被广泛视为启蒙时代最具影响力的思想家之一。
description.en: Locke is widely regarded as one of the most influential thinkers of the Enlightenment.

description.zh-cn: 洛克的著作对伏尔泰产生了巨大影响。
description.en: Locke's writings greatly influenced Voltaire.

description.zh-cn: 洛克的著作对让·雅各·卢梭产生了影响。
description.en: Locke's writings influenced Jean-Jacques Rousseau.

description.zh-cn: 洛克的自由和社会契约理论影响了许多美国开国元勋。
description.en: Locke's theories on liberty and the social contract influenced many of the American Founding Fathers.

description.zh-cn: 《美国独立宣言》受到了洛克的古典共和主义和自由主义观念的影响。
description.en: The Declaration of Independence was influenced by Locke's concepts of classical republicanism and liberalism.

description.zh-cn: 洛克发现笛卡尔等哲学家的著作比大学教材更有趣，尽管他批评笛卡尔的理论，但其著作仍对洛克产生了思想上的影响。
description.en: Locke found the works of philosophers like Descartes more interesting than university textbooks. Although he criticized Descartes' theories, his writings still had an intellectual influence on Locke.

description.zh-cn: 洛克发展出了一套与托马斯·霍布斯的自然状态不同的理论，显示霍布斯的思想是其理论建构的重要参照点。
description.en: Locke developed a theory of the state of nature that differed from that of Thomas Hobbes, indicating Hobbes's ideas were a significant reference point for Locke's theoretical constructions.

description.zh-cn: 洛克的政治理论激励了后来的美国革命。
description.en: Locke's political theories inspired the later American Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 洛克的政治理论激励了后来的法国大革命。
description.en: Locke's political theories inspired the later French Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 洛克与辉格党的创始人沙夫茨伯里伯爵关系密切，并参与其政治活动，其思想也深受辉格党影响。
description.en: Locke was closely associated with the Earl of Shaftesbury, a founder of the Whig party, participated in his political activities, and his ideas were greatly influenced by the Whigs.
